VB_PostFight_2P.synopsis: Two players hava just finished a fight with gnolls (biped canine-type monsters). Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas. Dialogue changes depending on if players know what gnolls are already.

Healthy_01.synopsis: A hyena in the plains is displeased when the player is close, wanting to devour them to please Yeenoghu.

DeathEvent.synopsis: The player encounters a dying hyena that is about to turn into a gnoll. If they discover this in time, they can try to stop the gnoll from being born. Otherwise, the gnoll is born and attacks the player when the dialogue ends.

VB_PostFight_1P.synopsis: A single player has just finished a fight with gnolls. Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas. Dialogue changes depending on if players know what gnolls are already.

VB_PostFight_3P.synopsis: Three players have just finished a fight with gnolls. Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas.

02.synopsis: A second player using Speak With Animals talks to a hyena while the first player speaks to the Dying Hyena. This will always end in combat.

PAD_HyenaRunning.synopsis: When the party starts the combat with dying hyenas, one of them - healthy hyena - will run away to call the gnolls nearby. This PAD is to ensure the player will understand what hyena is up to.
PAD_HyenaRunning.how_to_trigger: * Start a combat with hyenas at 26; 30; 527* One healthy hyena will bark and will try to run away during its turn.* One of the players will trigger the PAD

03.synopsis: A second player using Speak With Animals talks to a hyena while the first player speaks to the Dying Hyena. This will always end in combat.

SickHyena_AD_Groaning.synopsis: Sick dying hyena whimpering in pain: a new gnolls is about to be born from it.

AD_GnollBorn.synopsis: A hyena erupts, whining in agony as it dies, and unleashing a new gnoll into the world.

04.synopsis: A second player using Speak With Animals talks to a hyena while the first player speaks to the Dying Hyena. This will always end in combat.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Examining the session synopses reveals a chain of events around the dying hyena that is about to turn into a gnoll. In the DeathEvent, the player encounters the doomed hyena. If the player fails to intervene, the hyena first exhibits agonizing groans (captured in SickHyena_AD_Groaning) before finally erupting into a gnoll (AD_GnollBorn). Thus, there is a clear sequential chain: DeathEvent triggers the situation in which SickHyena_AD_Groaning then gives way to AD_GnollBorn. In addition, PAD_HyenaRunning is triggered as soon as combat with dying hyenas begins, which is directly tied to the DeathEvent encounter. Separately, the game provides several post-fight dialogue sessions – VB_PostFight_1P, VB_PostFight_2P, and VB_PostFight_3P – which depend solely on party composition (one, two, or three players) and cannot all occur in the same playthrough. Similarly, sessions labeled ‘02’, ‘03’, and ‘04’ describe essentially the same scenario where a second player speaks with a hyena while the first converses with the dying hyena, and only one of these can occur. Other sessions (such as Healthy_01) do not have dependencies or mutual exclusions with other sessions based on the provided information.

VB_PostFight_2P_0.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_2P_0.context: NodeContext: After a fight, you're reflecting on the monsters you've killed.

VB_PostFight_2P_1.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_2P_1.text: We'll have to keep an eye out for more.

VB_PostFight_2P_2.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_2P_2.text: Ugh - what a horrid sight that was.

VB_PostFight_2P_3.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_2P_3.text: Better keep an eye out for more.

Healthy_01_3.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01_3.text: Hate you. Not the Butcher's kin.

Healthy_01_7.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01_7.text: Go away. Or you will become new flesh.

Healthy_01_5.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01_5.text: I will make you new flesh.

Healthy_01_20.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01_20.text: Feed the beast. Feed the Butcher.

Healthy_01_10.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01_10.text: Your flesh will grow inside us. Better flesh, thinking flesh.

Healthy_01_6.speaker: Player
Healthy_01_6.text: I don't take orders from beasts.

DeathEvent_9.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_9.text: *The beautiful broken heap smells oddly enticing. You find you can't resist inhaling her offals.*
DeathEvent_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hyena is trying to drag herself to the player, but cannot due to the weight in her stomach.

DeathEvent_68.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_68.text: *You hear what comes next before you see it: the sharp snapping of bones and a yelp of pain as her body starts to twist and undulate.*

DeathEvent_0.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_0.text: *You watch with cold realisation - this isn't the end of one life, but the start of another...*

DeathEvent_35.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_35.text: *Her darling pups will not be of her own species. Gnolls bring forth their iniquitous litter from many corpsed wombs - including hyenas.*

DeathEvent_52.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_52.text: *...Gnolls - vicious, monstrous humanoids - can spawn from the corpses of dying hyenas.*

DeathEvent_69.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_69.text: Stifle your excitement. This is grotesque.

DeathEvent_29.context: NodeContext: Pained groan, then attempt to repeat 'hurts' falls away into deranged, pained laughter right before she dies

DeathEvent_62.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_62.text: Is there any way to stop this?

DeathEvent_16.text: No. Come closer - feed the new flesh.
DeathEvent_16.context: NodeContext: in agony, but full of glee as she is torn apart by a creature being born from within

DeathEvent_57.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_57.text: *Bones snap as the hyena is hollowed from the inside out, forming a vessel for something new.*

DeathEvent_26.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_26.text: Step back to watch the show.
DeathEvent_26.context: InternalNodeContext: Character gains advantage on initiative in the following combat.

DeathEvent_65.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_65.text: Revel in the creature's demonic influence.
DeathEvent_65.context: InternalNodeContext: Character gains advantage on initiative in the following combat.

DeathEvent_20.text: Feel its power, the Butcher is hungry. You, me - all meat.
DeathEvent_20.context: NodeContext: rapturous but in agony as chaos magic tears her apart

DeathEvent_50.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_50.text: Show mercy, ending her life swiftly.

DeathEvent_31.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_31.text: *Radiant power flows through you as you strike the creature down.*
DeathEvent_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: radiant effect as paladin strikes the hyena - re-using animation from other death-blows in this dialogue if possible

DeathEvent_11.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_11.text: Bless the hyena, trying to purge her body of evil.

DeathEvent_2.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_2.text: *Slowly, her broken body starts to calm, to stop its wild contortions. She lies still.*
DeathEvent_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hyena thrashes on the ground.

DeathEvent_59.text: Flesh inside is quiet - flesh inside is dead. Murderer.
DeathEvent_59.context: NodeContext: exhausted and accusatory - we just soothed her pain, but she lost her purpose and is dying anyway

DeathEvent_53.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_53.text: *The surge of holy power is rebuked, knocking you back.*
DeathEvent_53.context: InternalNodeContext: Player is dazed/stunned when combat begins.

DeathEvent_33.context: NodeContext: rapturous but in agony as chaos magic tears her apart

DeathEvent_60.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_60.text: Bless the hyena, trying to purge her body of evil.

DeathEvent_32.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_32.text: Strike while the beast is vulnerable.

DeathEvent_71.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_71.text: *You land a swift strike against her skull. She yelps, then goes still.*

DeathEvent_17.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_17.text: *Whatever horrific creature was growing inside the hyena dies along with her.*

DeathEvent_63.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_63.text: *As the life fades from her eyes, the gnoll within her dies too, stillborn.*

DeathEvent_54.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_54.text: *You strike quickly, but not quickly enough. She shrieks, thrashing helplessly.*
DeathEvent_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hyena thrashes on the ground.

DeathEvent_25.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_25.text: Can't leave me - new flesh needs to feed.
DeathEvent_25.context: NodeContext: in agony, about to 'become' a gnoll by gruesomely bursting open - still hungry and wants to eat us though

DeathEvent_67.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_67.text: *Her belly splits like a rotten fruit, birthing a frenzy of claws and fangs.*
DeathEvent_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: "Her belly split like a rotten fruit, birthing a frenzy of claws and fangs."

DeathEvent_43.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_43.text: *The raw hate of life, reared from the miracle of death. A tear almost springs to your eye.*

DeathEvent_41.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_41.text: *You move quickly, but not quickly enough.*

DeathEvent_18.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_18.text: *...Gnolls can spawn from the corpses of dying hyenas.*

DeathEvent_37.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_37.text: *The creature's eyes roll back in its head - equal parts bliss and agony.*
DeathEvent_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hyena is trying to drag herself to the player, but cannot due to the weight in her stomach.

DeathEvent_56.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_56.text: *Her offals smell irresistible, and while her bloodfeast has filled her, the hyena is not yet sated.*

DeathEvent_40.text: Come... see. My flesh becomes new flesh.
DeathEvent_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hyena is trying to drag herself to the player, but cannot due to the weight in her stomach.NodeContext: rapture and agony combined - she's dying, but also becoming something new

DeathEvent_48.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_48.text: *You hear what comes next before you see it: the sharp snapping of bones and a yelp of pain as her body starts to twist and undulate.*

DeathEvent_36.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_36.text: *You engrave her pained mewls upon your heart. Her back arches impossibly - a grace made possible only by it being broken.*

DeathEvent_39.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_39.text: *The hyena moans softly as its body contorts, ribs cracking and flesh tearing.*

DeathEvent_12.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_12.text: What's happening to you? Is there any way I can help?

DeathEvent_45.text: Yes - come closer. Feed the new flesh.
DeathEvent_45.context: NodeContext: in agony, but full of glee as she is torn apart by a creature being born from within

DeathEvent_14.speaker: Player
DeathEvent_14.text: Show mercy, ending her life swiftly.

DeathEvent_64.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_64.text: *She'd eaten. Feasted. And yet, looking into her eyes, you can see it wasn't enough. She's still hungry.*

DeathEvent_55.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent_55.text: *The beast reeks of brimstone and offal. Every breath is thick with blood.*
DeathEvent_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hyena is trying to drag herself to the player, but cannot due to the weight in her stomach.

VB_PostFight_1P_0.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_1P_0.text: What was that thing inside her?

VB_PostFight_3P_1.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P_1.text: I'd prefer not to see it again, that's for sure.

VB_PostFight_3P_4.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P_4.text: Best to move before the blood draws more of them.

VB_PostFight_3P_0.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P_0.text: Not a good sign that they're bursting to life everywhere.

VB_PostFight_3P_2.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P_2.text: Best to move before the blood draws more of them.

02_1.speaker: Narrator
02_1.text: *His fangs snap and gnash, biting down on nothing. He wants more.*

PAD_HyenaRunning_0.speaker: Player
PAD_HyenaRunning_0.text: Watch it - that hyena's going for help!

03_0.speaker: Narrator
03_0.text: *You might almost pity the creature. Too full to move, yet desperately starving.*

04_1.speaker: Narrator
04_1.text: *The hyena's eyes are mad with pain.*
